abstracts.cdata!:
The Road Maintenance and Rehabilitation
            Project (ROMARP) aims to bring about sustainable
            improvements in the quality of Malawi's road
            infrastructure by reducing transport costs and improving
            access. The project consists of four components. 1)
            Strengthening the road sector institutional framework will
            support institutional development and changes in various
            road sector agencies to accommodate the new sector policy
            framework. It will also support capacity building and skills
            development of road sector personnel for sustainable road
            sector management. 2) Development of the construction and
            consulting industries will support the establishment of the
            National Construction Industry Council as the principal
            stakeholder representative body for the development of the
            local industry and will support the development and
            implementation of action plans to address industry
            constraints. 3) Support to sustainable periodic maintenance
            will cover priority periodic maintenance requirements of the
            core network to assure road infrastructure quality. 4)
            Support to selective rehabilitation and upgrading will cover
            a limited amount of rehabilitation of the paved road network
            and a limited amount of earth to gravel or gravel to paved upgrading.
